net.sf.mmm.util.validation.base

Class ValidationFailureSuccess

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.validation.base.ValidationFailureSuccess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, AttributeReadMessage, AttributeReadMessageCode, AttributeReadUuid, Message, ValidationFailure

    public final class ValidationFailureSuccess
extends Object
implements ValidationFailure
    Placeholder implementation of ValidationFailure representing success used as internal representation where null is not suitable.
    Since:
    7.1.0
    Author:
    hohwille
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getDetails

        public String getDetails()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        This method gets optional details for this message. E.g. in case of an exception this can be the stacktrace.
        Specified by:
        getDetails in interface Message
        Returns:
        the details or null if no additional details are available.

      • getType

        public String getType()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        This method gets the type of this Message. This should be one of the following options:
        • "ValidationFailure" - for a ValidationFailure.
        • "UserError" - for an error caused by the end-user (e.g. by providing invalid data). Unlike Message.TYPE_VALIDATION_FAILURE this is an actual error that has been detected after a successful validation.
        • "TechnicalError" - for an error related to a technical problem (e.g. programming failure such as NullPointerException or operational error like ConnectException).
        • "Warning" - for a warning such as "The hit-list for your query has been truncated."). In such case it should be possible to continue the use-case or operation normally.
        • "Information" - for additional information - e.g. a hint.
        Specified by:
        getType in interface Message
        Returns:
        the message type.

      • getUuid

        public UUID getUuid()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        This method gets the UUID of this object. When the object is created, a UUID is generated. In case the object is created from another object that already has a UUID, the existing UUID will be used (e.g. for chained exceptions).
        The UUID will appear in a stacktrace but NOT in the message. It will therefore be written to log-files if the NlsThrowable is logged. If you supply the UUID to the end-user in an error panel or popup (see Message), he can provide it with the problem report so an administrator or software developer can easily find the stacktrace in the log-files.
        Specified by:
        getUuid in interface AttributeReadUuid
        Specified by:
        getUuid in interface Message
        Returns:
        the UUID if this Message. Will typically only be available if type is Message.TYPE_TECHNICAL_ERROR or Message.TYPE_USER_ERROR. Will be null if not available.

      • getSource

        public String getSource()
        Description copied from interface: ValidationFailure
        This method gets the (optional) source of the validation. It describes the origin of the given value. This may be the filename where the value was read from, an XPath where the value was located in an XML document, etc. It can be used to enrich messages displayed to end-users. This will help to find the problem easier.
        Specified by:
        getSource in interface Message
        Specified by:
        getSource in interface ValidationFailure
        Returns:
        the source or null if NOT available.

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage()
        Description copied from interface: ValidationFailure
        This method gets the message of the validation failure. This is a localized text displayed to end-users. It should explain the reason of the failure in a understandable but short form.
        Some examples are "This field may not be blank." or "This value has to be in the range from 5 to 9.". Depending on the usage the message may also contain the name of the field or other context information in order to determine the source of the problem.
        Specified by:
        getMessage in interface AttributeReadMessage
        Specified by:
        getMessage in interface ValidationFailure
        Returns:
        the message.
        See Also:
        Throwable.getMessage(), NlsThrowable, Message

      • getMessage

        public String getMessage(Locale locale)
        Description copied from interface: ValidationFailure
        This method gets the message localized for the given Locale.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is designed for server applications with NLS. On client side (e.g. for GWT clients) only a single locale may be supported at a time and this method will behave like ValidationFailure.getMessage() ignoring the lcoale.
        Specified by:
        getMessage in interface Message
        Specified by:
        getMessage in interface ValidationFailure
        Parameters:
        locale - is the Locale.
        Returns:
        the message.

      • getCode

        public String getCode()
        Description copied from interface: ValidationFailure
        This method gets the code of this ValidationFailure. The code is a stable identifier that indicates the type of the failure. It can be used for automated testing in order to make the test-cases independent from the actual message texts so they are maintainable and will not break e.g. if typos are fixed in the messages.
        Specified by:
        getCode in interface AttributeReadMessageCode
        Specified by:
        getCode in interface ValidationFailure
        Returns:
        the failure code.
        See Also:
        Throwable.getMessage(), NlsThrowable, Message
